description:
I have created three networks, one being without project specified, one belonging to demo tenant, and one being for admin tenant:
root@robinubuntu:~/devstack# nova-manage network list
id   	IPv4              	IPv6           	start address  	DNS1           DNS2           	VlanID         	project        	uuid           
1    	10.0.0.0/24       	None           	10.0.0.2       	8.8.4.4        None           	None           	None           	96f0d96d-586d-4a52-962b-4c0c0df7344e
2    	2.2.2.0/24        	None           	2.2.2.2        	8.8.4.4        None           	None           	53796e1d8af54656a46aad993fe1026a	c26af201-4ad8-4ba8-a85a-8ed9f9294bff
3    	3.3.3.0/24        	None           	3.3.3.2        	8.8.4.4        None           	None           	fb13a6ef279241f280973142df0d254f	f910b353-3ced-47b6-a1d0-464a7a4efe94

When I start a vm, the vm has three IP allocated,  one from each network.

I think vm's expected networks should be: public network ( without project specified) and the one belonging to the tenant.
title: all the networks are used for vm creation even with other tenants' ones

comments.content:
I have created three networks, one being without project specified, one belonging to demo tenant, and one being for admin tenant:

id   	IPv4              	IPv6           	start address  	DNS1           DNS2           	VlanID         	project        	uuid           
1    	10.0.0.0/24       	None           	10.0.0.2       	8.8.4.4        None           	None           	None           	96f0d96d-586d-4a52-962b-4c0c0df7344e
2    	2.2.2.0/24        	None           	2.2.2.2        	8.8.4.4        None           	None           	53796e1d8af54656a46aad993fe1026a	c26af201-4ad8-4ba8-a85a-8ed9f9294bff
3    	3.3.3.0/24        	None           	3.3.3.2        	8.8.4.4        None           	None           	fb13a6ef279241f280973142df0d254f	f910b353-3ced-47b6-a1d0-464a7a4efe94

When I start a vm, the vm has three IP allocated,  one from each network.

I think vm's expected networks should be: public network ( without project specified) and the one belonging to the tenant.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~gongysh

comments.content: Can you provide more detail about how you are starting the instance?  What parameters are you providing?  Also, what user are you using to start the instance?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~russellb

comments.content: We cannot solve the issue you reported without more information. Could you please provide the requested information ?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx

comments.content: This bug lacks the necessary information to effectively reproduce and fix it, therefore it has been closed. Feel free to reopen the bug by providing the requested information and set the bug status back to ''New''.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~dims-v
